title: Reasons Behind Slow Charging
answer:
**Reasons Behind Slow Charging**

If it is taking longer and longer to fully charge your phone, water may have entered the USB port when you make calls in the rain or when you hold your phone with wet hands. 

If so, your phone will decrease the charging current from 2 A to 0.5 A. As a result, the charging time is prolonged from three hours to 10 hours or longer. 

If water enters your phone, make sure the water is wiped completely before you charge your phone. 

So how can we determine whether water enters the USB port?

There is a water-indicating label inside the USB port that becomes red when in contact with water. 

If the water-indicating label becomes red, dry your phone before charging it. 

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20150601211622683001.jpg)

The preceding figure shows the USB port without water.

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20150601211622609002.jpg)

The preceding figure shows the USB port that has water inside.
